intro: Colchicum hungaricum, commonly known as the Hungarian colchic, is a bulbous perennial plant native to Central Europe. It produces striking violet-blue flowers in late summer, typically from August to September. The plant features a tall, leafless stem that bears a single, showy flower with reflexed petals. Its bulbs are toxic and contain colchicine, a compound used in medicine. It thrives in woodland and meadow habitats, preferring well-drained soil.
